## 

****

```bash
$ adb install test.apk
$ adb install -l test.apk     # forward lock application
$ adb install -r test.apk     # replace existing application
$ adb install -t test.apk     # allow test packages
$ adb install -s test.apk     # install application on sdcard
$ adb install -d test.apk     # allow version code downgrade
$ adb install -p test.apk     # partial application install
```

****

```bash
$ adb uninstall com.test.app
$ adb uninstall -k com.test.app # Keep the data and cache directories around after package removal.
```

****

```bash
$ adb shell pm list packages
$ adb shell pm list packages -f   # See their associated file.
$ adb shell pm list packages -d   # Filter to only show disabled packages.
$ adb shell pm list packages -e   # Filter to only show enabled packages.
$ adb shell pm list packages -s   # Filter to only show system packages.
$ adb shell pm list packages -3   # Filter to only show third party packages.
$ adb shell pm list packages -i   # See the installer for the packages.
$ adb shell pm list packages -u   # Also include uninstalled packages.
$ adb shell pm list packages --user <USER_ID> # The user space to query.
```

```bash
package:/system/priv-app/TeleService/TeleService.apk
```

## expr

expr Shell 

```bash
$ echo `expr 1 + 2`
3
```

expr `*` 

```bash
$ expr 1+2
1+2

$ expr 1 +2
expr: syntax error

$ expr 1 \* 2
2

$ expr 1 + 2.3
expr: not a decimal number: '2.3'
```

## 

 shell 

```bash
$ echo $((1+2))
3

$ ((i=1+2))

$ echo $i
3

$ echo $((1 + 2.3))
3.2999999999999998

$ echo $((2 ** 3))  # 
8
```

 `expr` 

## 

 `$` 

```bash
$ echo $[1 + 2]
3

$ echo $[2 ** 3]
8
```

## let

let `*` 

```bash
> $ let i = 1 + 2
zsh: bad math expression: operand expected at =

> $ let i=1+2
> $ echo $i
3

> $ let i=1+2.3
> $ echo $i
3

> $ let i=2**3
zsh: no matches found: i=2**3

> $ let i=1+2.6
> $ echo $i
3

> $ let i=2\*3
> $ echo $i
6
```

Post.title: Python  Redis watch  demo
Post._content:
Redis  watch 

<!-- more --><!-- toc -->

Redis  `multi/exec`  Mysql  `watch` 

 `watch`  `exec` 

Python  Pipeline  Redis 

****

```python
import redis

# 
pool = redis.ConnectionPool(host = '127.0.0.1', port=6379, db=0)
#  redis
r = redis.Redis(connection_pool = pool)
```

****

```python
pipe = r.pipeline()
```

****

```python
KEY = 'count'
try:
    pipe.watch(KEY)         # 
    pipe.multi()            # 
    pipe.set(KEY, 2)        # 
    pipe.execute()          # 
except Exception as e:
    # 
    pass
finally:
    pipe.reset()            # 
```

Post.title: Python  timeit
Post._content:
Python  `time.clock()`  `time.time()`

<!-- more --><!-- toc -->

## time.clock() vs time.time()
- `time.clock()`  CPU  windows 
- `time.time()`  windows 



```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

import time
import sys

if sys.platform == "win32":
    # On Windows, the best timer is time.clock()
    default_timer = time.clock
else:
    # On most other platforms the best timer is time.time()
    default_timer = time.time
```

 `timeit` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

import timeit

b = timeit.default_timer()
# to some
e = timeit.default_timer()
print(e - b)
```

`timeit.default_timer()` 

 `timeit` 

`timeit` Python  

## timeit

****

```python
$ python -m timeit '"-".join(str(n) for n in range(100))'
10000 loops, best of 3: 40.3 usec per loop
```

 10000  40.3 

****

```python
>>> import timeit
>>> # attribute is missing
>>> s = """\
... try:
...     str.__nonzero__
... except AttributeError:
...     pass
... """
>>> timeit.timeit(s)
0.5832341330096824
>>> timeit.timeit(s, number=1000)
0.000628526002401486
```

`number`  `default_number = 1000000`

```python
>>> timeit.repeat(s)
[0.5949273270089179, 0.6405833000026178, 0.5868908820120851]
>>> timeit.repeat(s, repeat=4)
[0.5963048749981681, 0.5834796829876723, 0.5749933830084046, 0.5814367970015155]
```

 `repeat()`  `repeat`  `default_repeat = 3`

## 

```bash
python -m timeit [-n N] [-r N] [-s S] [-t] [-c] [-h] [statement ...]
```
- `-n N, --number=N`  `statement` 
- `-r N, --repeat=N` 3
- `-s S, --setup=S` pass
- `-t, --time`  `time.time()`  windows 
- `-c, --clock`  `time.clock()`  windows 
- `-v, --verbose` 
- `-h, --help` 

 `-n`  10  0.2 

`-s` 

****

```bash
$ python -m timeit -s 'text = "sample string"; char = "g"'  'char in text'
10000000 loops, best of 3: 0.0877 usec per loop
```

****



```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

def test():
    """Stupid test function"""
    L = []
    for i in range(100):
        L.append(i)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import timeit
    print(timeit.timeit("test()", setup="from __main__ import test"))
```

- https://docs.python.org/2/library/timeit.html
- https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/2.7/Lib/timeit.py

Post.title: Python  gevent
Post._content:
> [gevent](https://github.com/gevent/gevent)  libev API

<!-- more --><!-- toc -->

Python 

Python 
- `yeild` python2.x
- `asynico + yield from` python3.4
- `asynico + await` python3.5

 gevent

geventGreenlet, CPython Greenlet

> 

 IO  Greenlet IO  CPU 

## 

 gevent

```bash
$ pip install gevent
```

 `gevent.sleep(0)` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

import gevent

import os
import threading
import time

def print_func_progress():
    print('[{}] Greenlet {} Process {} - Thread {}'.format(
        time.time(), gevent.getcurrent(), os.getpid(), threading.current_thread().ident))

def foo():
    print_func_progress()
    print('Running in foo')
    gevent.sleep(0)
    print('Explicit context switch to foo again')

def bar():
    print_func_progress()
    print('Explicit context to bar')
    gevent.sleep(0)
    print('Implicit context switch back to bar')

if __name__ == "__main__":
    gevent.joinall([
        gevent.spawn(foo),
        gevent.spawn(bar),
    ])

# [1553694796.1719072] Greenlet <Greenlet at 0x10e9a4930: foo> Process 2022 - Thread 4683818432
# Running in foo
# [1553694796.171974] Greenlet <Greenlet at 0x10e9a4a60: bar> Process 2022 - Thread 4683818432
# Explicit context to bar
# Explicit context switch to foo again
# Implicit context switch back to bar
```

 `Process` `Thread`

## 

 IO gevent 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

import gevent.monkey
gevent.monkey.patch_socket()

import gevent
import requests

import timeit

def print_func_run_time(count, func, **kw):
    b = timeit.default_timer()
    for i in range(count):
        func(**kw)
    print(func.__name__, 'run {} times used {}s'.format(count,
        timeit.default_timer() -b ))

def fetch(pid):
    print('pid {} begin request url', pid)
    response = requests.get('http://baidu.com')
    print('pid {} get response status {}', pid, response.status_code)

def synchronous():
    for i in range(0,5):
        fetch(i)

def asynchronous():
    threads = []
    for i in range(0,5):
        threads.append(gevent.spawn(fetch, i))
    gevent.joinall(threads)

print('Synchronous:')
print_func_run_time(1, synchronous)

print('Asynchronous:')
print_func_run_time(1, asynchronous)

# Synchronous:
# pid {} begin request url 0
# pid {} get response status {} 0 200
# pid {} begin request url 1
# pid {} get response status {} 1 200
# pid {} begin request url 2
# pid {} get response status {} 2 200
# pid {} begin request url 3
# pid {} get response status {} 3 200
# pid {} begin request url 4
# pid {} get response status {} 4 200
# synchronous run 1 times used 0.13507633499102667s
# Asynchronous:
# pid {} begin request url 0
# pid {} begin request url 1
# pid {} begin request url 2
# pid {} begin request url 3
# pid {} begin request url 4
# pid {} get response status {} 0 200
# pid {} get response status {} 4 200
# pid {} get response status {} 3 200
# pid {} get response status {} 1 200
# pid {} get response status {} 2 200
# asynchronous run 1 times used 0.03902721201302484s
```

##

 `gevent.sleep(0)` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

import gevent

import os
import threading
import time

def print_func_progress():
    print('[{}] Greenlet {} Process {} - Thread {}'.format(
        time.time(), gevent.getcurrent(), os.getpid(), threading.current_thread().ident))

def foo():
    print_func_progress()
    print('Running in foo')
    gevent.sleep(0)
    print('Explicit context switch to foo again')

def bar():
    print_func_progress()
    print('Explicit context to bar')
    gevent.sleep(0)
    print('Implicit context switch back to bar')

if __name__ == "__main__":
    gevent.joinall([
        gevent.spawn(foo),
        gevent.spawn(bar),
    ])

# [1553694796.1719072] Greenlet <Greenlet at 0x10e9a4930: foo> Process 2022 - Thread 4683818432
# Running in foo
# [1553694796.171974] Greenlet <Greenlet at 0x10e9a4a60: bar> Process 2022 - Thread 4683818432
# Explicit context to bar
# Explicit context switch to foo again
# Implicit context switch back to bar
```

 `Process` `Thread`

## 

 IO gevent 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

import gevent.monkey
gevent.monkey.patch_socket()

import gevent
import requests

import timeit

def print_func_run_time(count, func, **kw):
    b = timeit.default_timer()
    for i in range(count):
        func(**kw)
    print(func.__name__, 'run {} times used {}s'.format(count,
        timeit.default_timer() -b ))

def fetch(pid):
    print('pid {} begin request url', pid)
    response = requests.get('http://baidu.com')
    print('pid {} get response status {}', pid, response.status_code)

def synchronous():
    for i in range(0,5):
        fetch(i)

def asynchronous():
    threads = []
    for i in range(0,5):
        threads.append(gevent.spawn(fetch, i))
    gevent.joinall(threads)

print('Synchronous:')
print_func_run_time(1, synchronous)

print('Asynchronous:')
print_func_run_time(1, asynchronous)

# Synchronous:
# pid {} begin request url 0
# pid {} get response status {} 0 200
# pid {} begin request url 1
# pid {} get response status {} 1 200
# pid {} begin request url 2
# pid {} get response status {} 2 200
# pid {} begin request url 3
# pid {} get response status {} 3 200
# pid {} begin request url 4
# pid {} get response status {} 4 200
# synchronous run 1 times used 0.13507633499102667s
# Asynchronous:
# pid {} begin request url 0
# pid {} begin request url 1
# pid {} begin request url 2
# pid {} begin request url 3
# pid {} begin request url 4
# pid {} get response status {} 0 200
# pid {} get response status {} 4 200
# pid {} get response status {} 3 200
# pid {} get response status {} 1 200
# pid {} get response status {} 2 200
# asynchronous run 1 times used 0.03902721201302484s
```

## 

[](https://github.com/aliyun/ossfs/releases)

**Ubuntu 16.04**

```bash
$ wget https://github.com/aliyun/ossfs/releases/download/v1.80.5/ossfs_1.80.5_ubuntu16.04_amd64.deb
$ sudo apt-get update
$ sudo apt-get install gdebi-core
```

**CentOS 7**

```bash
$ wget https://github.com/aliyun/ossfs/releases/download/v1.80.5/ossfs_1.80.5_centos7.0_x86_64.rpm
$ sudo yum localinstall ossfs_1.80.5_centos7.0_x86_64.rpm
```

** bucket **

```bash
$ echo my-bucket:my-access-key-id:my-access-key-secret > /etc/passwd-ossfs  #  key  secret
$ chmod 640 /etc/passwd-ossfs   # 
$ ossfs my-bucket local_dir_path -ourl=my-oss-endpoint  #  bucket mount 
```

 `-f -d`  ossfs debug

Post.title: SQLAlchemy Can't resolve label reference for ORDER BY / GROUP BY ...
Post._content:
`insert ... on duplicate key update ..` SQLAlchemy  1.1.5  1.3.1

<!-- more -->

```bash
Can't resolve label reference for ORDER BY / GROUP BY. Textual SQL expression 'rank desc' should be explicitly declared as text('rank desc')
```



```bash
SAWarning: Can't resolve label reference 'rank desc'; converting to text() (this warning may be suppressed after 10 occurrences)
```

 `order_by('rank desc')` 



 `ORDER BY`  SQL 

```mysql
> select * from user order by id desc;
```

SQLAlchemy 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

# 
db.session.query(User).order_by('id desc').all()

#  SQLAlchemy 
db.session.query(User).order_by(User.id.desc()).all()

# 
from sqlalchemy import desc
db.session.query(User).order_by(desc(User.id)).all()
```

OK

```bash
AttributeError: type object 'VisitorLog' has no attribute 'rank'
```



 SQL 

```mysql
> select url, count(url) as rank from visit_log group by url order by rank desc;
```

 SQLAlchemy 

```python
from sqlalchemy import func
cls = VisitLog
res = db.session.query(
    cls.url, func.count(cls.url).label('rank')
).group_by(cls.url).order_by('rank desc').all()
```



```python
from sqlalchemy import func
cls = VisitLog
res = db.session.query(
    cls.url, func.count(cls.url).label('rank')
).group_by(cls.url).order_by(cls.rank.desc).all()
```

 `rank`  `label`  `as`  `label`  `desc()` 

```python
from sqlalchemy import func
cls = VisitLog
rank = func.count(cls.url).label('rank')
res = db.session.query(
    cls.url, rank
).group_by(cls.url).order_by(rank.desc).all()
```



 `GROUP BY` 

- [](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/core/sqlelement.html#sqlalchemy.sql.expression.desc)
- [python-sqlalchemy-label-usage](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15555920/python-sqlalchemy-label-usage)

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
```
```python
# Description: for while generator list_comprehension map 

def loop_for(n):
    res = []
    for i in range(n):
        res.append(abs(i))
    return res

def loop_while(n):
    i = 0
    res = []
    while i < n:
        res.append(abs(i))
        i += 1
    return res

def loop_generator(n):
    ''''''
    res = (abs(i) for i in range(n))
    res =  list(res)
    return res

def loop_list_compre(n):
    ''''''
    res = [abs(i) for i in range(n)]
    return res

def loop_map(n):
    ''' map'''
    return list(map(abs, range(n)))

import unittest

class TestMain(unittest.TestCase):

    def setUp(self):
        '''before each test function'''
        pass

    def tearDown(self):
        '''after each test function'''
        pass

    def test_func(self):
        n = 10
        # 
        flag = (loop_for(n) == loop_while(n) == loop_generator(n) ==
                loop_list_compre(n) == loop_map(n))
        self.assertTrue(flag)

import timeit

def print_func_run_time(count, func, **kw):
    b = timeit.default_timer()
    for i in range(count):
        func(**kw)
    print('{} run {} times used {}s'.format(
        func.__name__.ljust(20),
        count,
        timeit.default_timer() -b ))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    count = 1000
    n = 1000
    print_func_run_time(count, loop_for, n = n)
    print_func_run_time(count, loop_while, n = n)
    print_func_run_time(count, loop_generator, n = n)
    print_func_run_time(count, loop_list_compre, n = n)
    print_func_run_time(count, loop_map, n = n)
    unittest.main()

# .
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
# Ran 1 test in 0.000s
#
# OK
# loop_for             run 1000 times used 0.14018906400087872s
# loop_while           run 1000 times used 0.21399457900042762s
# loop_generator       run 1000 times used 0.12857274799898732s
# loop_list_compre     run 1000 times used 0.08585307099929196s
# loop_map             run 1000 times used 0.043123570998432115s
```

```bash
map >  >  > for > while
```

 Mac 

##  pbcopy  pbpaste

 Mac  `pbcopy`  `pbpaste` 

`pbcopy` `pbpaste` 

```bash
$ echo '' | pbcopy
$ pbpaste

```

 Python 

 `subprocess`  `Popen` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:  Mac 

import subprocess

def set_clipboard(data: str):
    p = subprocess.Popen(['pbcopy'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE)
    p.stdin.write(data.encode("utf-8"))
    p.stdin.close()
    p.communicate()

def get_from_clipboard():
    p = subprocess.Popen(['pbpaste'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
    p.wait()
    byte_data = p.stdout.read()
    p.stdout.close()
    return byte_data.decode('utf-8')

if __name__ == "__main__":
    set_clipboard('')
    print(get_from_clipboard())

# python clipboard.py
# 
```

 [pyperclip](https://github.com/asweigart/pyperclip)

```python
>>> pyperclip.copy('The text to be copied to the clipboard.')
>>> pyperclip.paste()

```

```bash
$ ffmpeg -y -i mavel4.mp4 \
    -vf "drawtext=\
        text='Avengers\: Endgame':\
        x=700:\
        y=200:\
        fontsize=24:\
        fontcolor=red:\
        " \
    mavel4_drawtext.mp4
```



- `drawtext=` `:`

Post.title: Python
Post._content:
Python  `open()` 

<!-- more -->


****

```bash
f = open(file, [mode])
```

Mode:
- `x` 
- `w` 
- `r` 
- `a` 
- `t`  text 
- `b` 

****

```python
>>> f = open('/tmp/test', 'x')
>>> f = open('/tmp/test', 'x')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
    f = open('/tmp/test', 'x')
FileExistsError: [Errno 17] File exists: '/tmp/test'
```

****

```python
>>> f = open('/tmp/test1', 'w')
>>> f.close()
>>> f = open('/tmp/test1', 'w')
>>> f.write('hw')
2
>>> f.close()
```

****

```python
>>> f = open('/tmp/test1', 'a')
>>> f.write('hw')
2
>>> f.close()
>>> f = open('/tmp/test1', 'r')
>>> f.read()
'hwhw'
```

****

```python
>>> f = open('/tmp/test1', 'r')
>>> f.read()
'hwhw'
>>> f.close()
>>> f = open('/tmp/test1', 'rb')    # 
>>> f.read()
b'hwhw'
>>> f.close()
```

- [Python File Handling: Create, Open, Append, Read, Write](https://www.guru99.com/reading-and-writing-files-in-python.htm)

Post.title: Python  ini
Post._content:
Python  `configparser`  ini 

<!-- more --><!-- toc -->

 `example.ini` 

```bash
ServerAliveInterval = 45
Compression = yes
CompressionLevel = 9
ForwardX11 = yes

[bitbucket.org]
User = hg

[topsecret.server.com]
Port = 50022
ForwardX11 = no
```

****

`configparser.ConfigParser()`  `dict` 

```python
>>> import configparser
>>> config = configparser.ConfigParser()
>>> config['DEFAULT'] = {'ServerAliveInterval': '45',
...                      'Compression': 'yes',
...                      'CompressionLevel': '9'}
>>> config['bitbucket.org'] = {}
>>> config['bitbucket.org']['User'] = 'hg'
>>> config['topsecret.server.com'] = {}
>>> topsecret = config['topsecret.server.com']
>>> topsecret['Port'] = '50022'     # mutates the parser
>>> topsecret['ForwardX11'] = 'no'  # same here
>>> config['DEFAULT']['ForwardX11'] = 'yes'
>>> with open('example.ini', 'w') as configfile:
...   config.write(configfile)
...
```

****

```python
>>> config = configparser.ConfigParser()
>>> config.sections()
[]
>>> config.read('example.ini')
['example.ini']
>>> config.sections()
['bitbucket.org', 'topsecret.server.com']
>>> 'bitbucket.org' in config
True
>>> 'bytebong.com' in config
False
>>> config['bitbucket.org']['User']
'hg'
>>> config['DEFAULT']['Compression']
'yes'
>>> topsecret = config['topsecret.server.com']
>>> topsecret['ForwardX11']
'no'
>>> topsecret['Port']
'50022'
>>> for key in config['bitbucket.org']:
...     print(key)
user
compressionlevel
serveraliveinterval
compression
forwardx11
>>> config['bitbucket.org']['ForwardX11']
'yes'
```

****



```python
def config(filepath, section, **data):
    '''
    filepath: 
    '''
    conf = configparser.ConfigParser()
    if os.path.exists(filepath):
        conf.read(filepath)

    conf[section] = data

    with open(filepath, 'w') as f:
        conf.write(f)
        f.close()
```

- [configparser](https://docs.python.org/3/library/configparser.html)

```python
def config(filepath, section, **data):
    '''
    filepath:

    conf = configparser.ConfigParser()
    if os.path.exists(filepath):
```

Github  `.zip`  `.tar.gz`

`zip`  [Linux zip  unzip ](/2018/09/19/zip-unzip/)

 `tar` 

<!-- toc -->

 `tar`  `gzip`  `.gz` 


```bash
$ tar cvf pm2.log.tar pm2.log       # 
$ tar zcvf pm2.log.tar.gz pm2.log   # 
$ zip pm2.zip pm2.log               #  zip 
$ ll
-rw-r--r--    1 wxnacy  staff  259615701 Apr 13 06:37 pm2.log
-rw-r--r--    1 wxnacy  staff  259617280 Apr 13 09:47 pm2.log.tar
-rw-r--r--    1 wxnacy  staff    7746015 Apr 13 09:48 pm2.log.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--    1 wxnacy  staff    7763656 Apr 13 09:51 pm2.zip
```

 `zip`  `tar` 

## 

```bash
$ tar cvf <filename>.tar <filename|dirname>     # 
$ tar xvf <filename>.tar                        # 
```

##  .gz 

```bash
$ tar zcvf <filename>.tar.gz <filename|dirname>     # 
$ tar zxvf <filename>.tar.gz                        # 
```

##  .bz2 

```bash
$ tar jcvf <filename>.tar.bz2 <filename|dirname>     # 
$ tar jxvf <filename>.tar.bz2                        # 
```

## 



- `-A` 
- `-B` 
- `-c` 
- `-d` 
- `-r` 
- `-u` 
- `-x` 
- `-t` 
- `-z` gzip
- `-j` bzip2
- `-Z` compress
- `-v` 
- `-l` 
- `-k` 
- `-m` 
- `-W` 



- `-b`

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
```

```python
from enum import Enum

class Color(Enum):
    BLACK = 30
    RED = 31
    GREEN = 32
    YELLOW = 33
    BLUE = 34
    MAGENTA = 35
```

Post.title: SQLAlchemy
Post._content:
SQLAlchemy  DB DB  DB 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->



 Google  `commit`

 `session.commit()` 

```python
engine = create_engine('db_url', isolation_level = 'READ COMMITTED')
```

`isolation_level` 
- READ COMMITTED
- READ UNCOMMITTED
- REPEATABLE READ
- SERIALIZABLE
- AUTOCOMMIT

 `READ COMMITTED`  DB `AUTOCOMMIT` 

 `flask_sqlalchemy` `app.config` 

```python
SQLALCHEMY_COMMIT_ON_TEARDOWN = True
```

 `True`  `commit` 

```python
@app.teardown_appcontext
def shutdown_session(response_or_exc):
    if app.config['SQLALCHEMY_COMMIT_ON_TEARDOWN']:
        if response_or_exc is None:
            self.session.commit()

    self.session.remove()
    return response_or_exc
```

- [Engine Creation API](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/core/engines.html#engine-creation-api)
- [Mysql Transaction Isolation Level](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/dialects/mysql.html#transaction-isolation-level)

Post.title: awk
Post._content:
awk 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

 [text](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/file/master/common/text) 

```bash
$ ll > text
```

![1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/awk1_548.png)

## 

 `10` 

```bash
$ awk '/10/ {print $0}' text
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff    1052 Mar 13 22:50 awktest
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     100 Mar 25 22:53 b.py
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     121 Mar 14 10:19 test.go
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     106 Mar 13 10:53 test.js
```

 8 

```bash
$ awk '$8 ~ /10/ {print $0}' text
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     121 Mar 14 10:19 test.go
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     106 Mar 13 10:53 test.js
```

 `10` 

awk  shell 

```bash
$ hour=10
$ echo $hour
10
$ awk '$8 ~ /'"$hour"'/ {print $0}' text
```

`$hour`  `'""'` 

 awk  `-v` 

```bash
$ awk -v hour=10 '$8 ~ hour {print $0}' text
```

 `//` 


 `18` 

```bash
$ awk -v hour=18 '$8 ~ hour"$" {print $0}' text
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     861 Apr 17 18:18 test
```

 `if` 

```bash
$ awk -v hour=18 '{ if ($8 ~ hour"$") {print $0} }' text
```

 `if` 

## 



```bash
$ touch split.awk
$ chmod +x split.awk
$ vim split.awk
```

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env awk -f

{
    if ($8 ~ hour"$"){
        print $0
    }
}
```



```bash
$ ./split.awk -v hour=18 text
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff     861 Apr 17 18:18 test
```



 `match()` 

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env awk -f

{
    if (match($8 , hour"$")){
        print $0
    }
}
```

- [How to use awk variables in regular expressions?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11534173/how-to-use-awk-variables-in-regular-expressions)

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

from PIL import ImageGrab
from PIL import Image
```
```python
import io

img = ImageGrab.grabclipboard()
img_bytes = io.BytesIO()
if isinstance(img, Image.Image):
    #  img.save('test.png', 'png')
    img.save(img_bytes, 'png')
    print(img_bytes.getvalue())
```

Post.title: Python  memory_profiler
Post._content:
Python  memory_profiler 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

memory_profiler 

## 

```bash
$ pip install memory_profiler
```

## 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

from memory_profiler import profile

@profile
def test1():
    c = []
    a = [1, 2, 3] * (2 ** 20)
    b = [1] * (2 ** 20)
    c.extend(a)
    c.extend(b)
    del b
    del c

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test1()
```

```bash
$ python -m memory_profiler memory_profiler
```

![1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/pmf1.png)



- `Mem usage` 
- `Increment` 



-  `@profile` 
-  `python -m memory_profiler`  `python` 

`del` 

## 

- `precision` 

 `MiB`

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

from memory_profiler import profile


@profile(precision=4)
def test3():
    a = [1, 2] * (2 ** 10)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test3()
```

![3](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/pmf3.png)

- `stream` 



```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

from memory_profiler import profile

@profile(precision=4, @profile(precision=4, stream=open('/tmp/memory_profiler.log','w+')))
def test3():
    a = [1, 2] * (2 ** 10)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    test3()
```

![4](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/pmf4.png)

## mprof 

memory_profiler  `mprof`

```bash
Usage: mprof <command> <options> <arguments>

Available commands:

    run       python 
    rm        mprof 
    clean     mprof 
    list     
    plot      mprof run 

Type mprof <command> --help for usage help on a specific command.
For example, mprof plot --help will list all plotting options.
```

 `plot` `run`  `.dat` `plot`  `matplotlib` 

```bash
$ pip install matplotlib
$ mprof run memory_profiler_demo.py
$ mprof list
0 mprofile_20190505182200.dat 18:22:00 05/05/2019
$ mprof plot mprofile_20190505182200.dat
```



![5](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/pmf5_1260.png)

```bash
    plot      mprof run 

Type mprof <command> --help for usage help on a specific command.
For example, mprof plot --help will list all plotting options.
```

Post.title: Python list
Post._content:
Python list 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

                 | 
----                 | ---------
list[i]              | O(1)
list[i] = 1          | O(1)
list[i:j]            | O(k)  k = j - i
list[i:k] = list()   | O(n + k)
list.index(item)     | O(n)
list.append(item)    | O(1)
list.insert(i, item) | O(n)
list.pop()           | O(1)
list.pop(i)          | O(n) 
del list[i]          | O(n)
item in list         | O(n)
list.reverse()       | O(n)
list.sort()          | O(n logn)

![4](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/git-blame4.png)



```bash
usage: git blame [<options>] [<rev-opts>] [<rev>] [--] <file>

    <rev-opts> are documented in git-rev-list(1)

    --incremental         Show blame entries as we find them, incrementally
    -b                    Show blank SHA-1 for boundary commits (Default: off)
    --root                Do not treat root commits as boundaries (Default: off)
    --show-stats          Show work cost statistics
    --progress            Force progress reporting
    --score-debug         Show output score for blame entries
    -f, --show-name       Show original filename (Default: auto)
    -n, --show-number     Show original linenumber (Default: off)
    -p, --porcelain       Show in a format designed for machine consumption
    --line-porcelain      Show porcelain format with per-line commit information
    -c                    Use the same output mode as git-annotate (Default: off)
    -t                    
    -l                     commit sha1
    -s                    Suppress author name and timestamp (Default: off)
    -e, --show-email      
    -w                    Ignore whitespace differences
    --indent-heuristic    Use an experimental heuristic to improve diffs
    --minimal             Spend extra cycles to find better match
    -S <file>             Use revisions from <file> instead of calling git-rev-list
    --contents <file>     Use <file>'s contents as the final image
    -C[<score>]           Find line copies within and across files
    -M[<score>]           Find line movements within and across files
    -L <n,m>              Process only line range n,m, counting from 1
    --abbrev[=<n>]        use <n> digits to display SHA-1s
```

- [git-blame](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-blame)

302% ``` `-L` `-I` ```bash $ curl -IL -w "%{http_code}" https://baidu.com HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily Server: bfe/1.0.8.18 Date: Thu, 06 Jun 2019 00:25:02 GMT Content-Type: text/html Content-Length: 161 Connection: keep-alive Location: http://www.baidu.com/ HTTP/1.1 200 OK Accept-Ranges: bytes Cache-Control: private, no-cache, no-store, proxy-revalidate, no-transform Connection: Keep-Alive Content-Length: 277 Content-Type: text/html Date: Thu, 06 Jun 2019 00:25:05 GMT Etag: "575e1f60-115" Last-Modified: Mon, 13 Jun 2016 02:50:08 GMT Pragma: no-cache Server: bfe/1.0.8.18 200% ``` `/dev/null` ```bash $ curl -IL -w "%{http_code}" -o /dev/null https://baidu.com % Total % Received % Xferd Average Speed Time Time Time Current Dload Upload Total Spent Left Speed 0 161 0 0 0 0 0 0 --:--:-- 0:00:03 --:--:-- 0 0 277 0 0 0 0 0 0 --:--:-- 0:00:03 --:--:-- 0 200% ``` `-s` ```bash $ curl -sIL -w "%{http_code}" -o /dev/null https://baidu.com 200% ``` `%` **** ```bash $ curl -sIL -w "%{http_code}\n" -o /dev/null https://baidu.com 200 ``` ** echo** ```bash $ echo $(curl -sIL -w "%{http_code}" -o /dev/null https://baidu.com) 200 ``` `-w` - `url_effective` - `http_code` - `http_connect` - `time_total` - `time_namelookup` DNS https://baidu.com ip - `time_connect` TCP - `time_appconnect` SSL/SSH connect/handshake - `time_redirect` - `time_pretransfer` - `time_starttransfer` - `size_download` - `size_upload` - `size_header` - `size_request` - `speed_download` - `speed_upload` - `content_type` - `num_connects` - `num_redirects` - `ftp_entry_path`

Post.title: Python  bisect
Post._content:
Python  bisect 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->





```python
>>> a = [1, 4, 4, 5, 6]
```

 `4`

```python
>>> import bisect
>>> bisect.bisect(a, 4)
3
```

`bisect()`  `bisect_right()`  `bisect_left()` `bisect_right()`  `bisect()`  `bisect()` 

```python
>>> bisect.bisect_left(a, 4)
1
```

 `insort()` 

```python
>>> bisect.insort(a, 4)
>>> a
[1, 4, 4, 4, 5, 6]
```

 `insort_left()`  `insort_right()`

 `bisect` `bisect.bisect()` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

import bisect

def binary_search(nums, n):
    i = bisect.bisect_left(nums, n)
    if i >= len(nums):
        return -1
    else:
        if nums[i] == n:
            return i
        else:
            return -1
```



```python
>>> a.reverse()
>>> a
[6, 5, 4, 4, 2, 1]
>>> bisect.insort_left(a, 2)
>>> a
[2, 6, 5, 4, 4, 2, 1]
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

import bisect

def binary_search(nums, n):
    i = bisect.bisect_left(nums, n)
    if i >= len(nums):
        return -1
    else:
        if nums[i] == n:
            return i
        else:
            return -1
```



```python
>>> a.reverse()
>>> a
[6, 5, 4, 4, 2, 1]
>>> bisect.insort_left(a, 2)
>>> a
[2, 6, 5, 4, 4, 2, 1]
```

Post.title: Python collections.namedtuple()
Post._content:
`collections`  `namedtuple()` 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->



```python
>>> from collections import namedtuple
>>> User = namedtuple('User', ['name', 'age'])
>>> u = User('wxnacy', 12)
>>> u
User(name='wxnacy', age=12)
>>> u.name
'wxnacy'
>>> u[1]
12
>>> type(u)
<class '__main__.User'>
```

`namedtuple()` 

```python
collections.namedtuple(typename, field_names, *, rename=False, defaults=None, module=None)
```

- `typename` 
- `field_names`  `[x, y]` `x y`  `x, y`
    [](https://docs.python.org/zh-cn/3/library/keyword.html#module-keyword) `_name`, 'class' 
- `rename`  `['abc', 'def', 'ghi', 'abc']`  `['abc', '_1', 'ghi', '_3']`   def  abc
- `defaults`  None  iterable defaults  ['x', 'y', 'z']  (1, 2)  x  y  1  z  2 
- `module`  `__module__` 

****



- `classmethod somenamedtuple._make(iterable)` 

```python
>>> User._make(['wxnacy', 18])
User(name='wxnacy', age=18)
```

- `somenamedtuple._asdict()`  OrderedDict 

```python
>>> u = User._make(['wxnacy', 18])
>>> u._asdict()
OrderedDict([('name', 'wxnacy'), ('age', 18)])
```

- `somenamedtuple._replace(**kwargs)` 

```python
>>> u._replace(name = 'winn')
User(name='winn', age=18)
```

- `somenamedtuple._fields` 

```python
>>> u._fields
('name', 'age')
```

- `somenamedtuple._field_defaults` 

```python
>>> User = namedtuple('User', ['name', 'age'], defaults=['wxnacy', 18])
>>> u = User()
>>> u._fields_defaults
{'name': 'wxnacy', 'age': 18}
```

`3.5` 

```python
>>> User = namedtuple('User', ['name', 'age'], defaults=['wxnacy', 18])
>>> User.__doc__
'User(name, age)'
>>> User.__doc__ += ": user in collection"
>>> User.__doc__
'User(name, age): user in collection'
>>> User.name.__doc__ = "User name"
>>> User.name.__doc__
'User name'
```


- [namedtuple()](https://docs.python.org/zh-cn/3/library/collections.html#collections.namedtuple)

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# filename: demo.py

import argparse
parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='This is a argparse demo')
```
```python
parser.add_argument('file', help='List file or dir')
parser.add_argument('-u', '--user', help='Config user name')
args = parser.parse_args()
print(args.file)
print(args.user)
```

```bash
$ python demo.py bashrc -u wxnacy
bashrc
wxnacy
```

Post.title: apt  [Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock-frontend]
Post._content:
- `Synaptic Package Manager`  `Software Updater` 
- apt

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

```bash
$ sudo apt install -y redis
E: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock-frontend - open (11: Resource temporarily unavailable)
E: Unable to acquire the dpkg frontend lock (/var/lib/dpkg/lock-frontend), is another process using it?
```

****

```bash
$ ps aux | grep apt
root 1747 0.0 0.0 4628 808 ? Ss 07:06 0:00 /bin/sh /usr/lib/apt/apt.systemd.daily update
root 1769 0.0 0.0 4628 1820 ? S 07:06 0:00 /bin/sh /usr/lib/apt/apt.systemd.daily lock_is_held update
_apt 16225 3.0 0.2 80192 8796 ? S 07:07 0:04 /usr/lib/apt/methods/http
_apt 16226 0.7 0.2 80188 8800 ? S 07:07 0:01 /usr/lib/apt/methods/http
```

****

```bash
$ sudo killall apt apt-get
```

 pid 

```bash
$ sudo kill -9 <pid>
```

****

```bash
$ sudo rm /var/lib/apt/lists/lock
$ sudo rm /var/cache/apt/archives/lock
$ sudo rm /var/lib/dpkg/lock*
```

** dpkg**

```bash
$ sudo dpkg --configure -a
dpkg: error: parsing file '/var/lib/dpkg/updates/0004' near line 0:
newline in field name '#padding'
```



```bash
$ sudo rm -rf /var/lib/dpkg/updates/0004
```



```bash
$ sudo apt update -y
$ sudo apt install -y redis
```

```bash
resolver 8.8.8.8 ipv6=off;
```

Post.title: Python  Requests
Post._content:
[Requests](https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests)  Python  http 

<!-- more -->



****

```python
>>> from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth
>>> requests.get('https://api.github.com/user', auth=HTTPBasicAuth('user', 'pass'))
<Response [200]>
```



```python
>>> requests.get('https://api.github.com/user', auth=('user', 'pass'))
<Response [200]>
```

****

```python
>>> from requests.auth import HTTPDigestAuth
>>> url = 'http://httpbin.org/digest-auth/auth/user/pass'
>>> requests.get(url, auth=HTTPDigestAuth('user', 'pass'))
<Response [200]>
```

**OAuth 1**

```python
>>> import requests
>>> from requests_oauthlib import OAuth1
>>> url = 'https://api.twitter.com/1.1/account/verify_credentials.json'
>>> auth = OAuth1('YOUR_APP_KEY', 'YOUR_APP_SECRET',
...               'USER_OAUTH_TOKEN', 'USER_OAUTH_TOKEN_SECRET')
>>> requests.get(url, auth=auth)
<Response [200]>
```

 OAuth 2[](http://docs.python-requests.org/zh_CN/latest/user/authentication.html?highlight=requests.auth#oauth-2-openid)


Post.title: Python  f-string expression part cannot include a backslash
Post._content:
Python 3.6  `f-string` 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->



```python
>>> n = 2
>>> f'say {"\t" * n}'
  File "<input>", line 1
SyntaxError: f-string expression part cannot include a backslash
```

 `f-string` 



****



```python
>>> n = 2
>>> tables = "\t" * n
>>> f'say {tables}'
'say \t\t'
```

** format **

```python
>>> 'say {}'.format('\t' * n)
'say \t\t'
```

```bash

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                CREATED             STATUS                     PORTS               NAMES
7c4a4cea19aa        ubuntu:bionic       "echo 'hello world'"   3 minutes ago       Exited (0) 7 seconds ago                       elegant_brahmagupta
```

 `-it` 

```bash

root@82a4d9031d1c:/# ls
bin   dev  home  lib64  mnt  proc  run   srv  tmp  var
boot  etc  lib   media  opt  root  sbin  sys  usr
root@82a4d9031d1c:/# exit
exit
```

 docker run Docker 

- 
- 
- 
- 
-  ip 
-

****

```bash

```



```bash

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                CREATED              STATUS                          PORTS               NAMES
7c4a4cea19aa        ubuntu:bionic       "echo 'hello world'"   About a minute ago   Exited (0) About a minute ago                       elegant_brahmagupta
82a4d9031d1c        ubuntu:bionic       "/bin/bash"            2 minutes ago        Exited (0) About a minute ago                       tender_jennings

82a4d9031d1c

$ docker container ls                       # 3
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                CREATED             STATUS                          PORTS               NAMES

$ docker exec -it 82a4d9031d1c /bin/bash    # 4

  PID TTY          TIME CMD
   25 pts/1    00:00:00 bash
   34 pts/1    00:00:00 ps
```


```bash
exit
```

![2](https://wxnacy.com/images/mp.jpg)

****

## 

 web 

 https://github.com/wxnacy/study/blob/master/python/pillow_demo/overlay.py



```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description: 

import io

from PIL import Image
import requests


def get_image(path):
    ''' image '''
    image = None
    if path.startswith('http'):
        res = requests.get(path)
        image = Image.open(io.BytesIO(res.content))
    else:
        image = Image.open(path)
    return image

def image2bytes(image):
    ''''''
    img_bytes = io.BytesIO()
    image.save(img_bytes, image.format)
    return img_bytes.getvalue()

def overlay(big_path, small_path, width, height, small_thumbnail=()):
    ''''''
    big_image = get_image(big_path)
    small_image = get_image(small_path)
    if small_thumbnail:
        small_image.thumbnail(small_thumbnail)
    big_image.paste(small_image,(width, height))
    big_image.show()    # 
    #  big_image.save('/Users/wxnacy/Downloads/pillow_overlay.png')  # 
    # 
    return image2bytes(big_image)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    overlay('https://wxnacy.com/images/rss.png',
            'https://wxnacy.com/images/mp.jpg', 157, 45)
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description: 

import io

from PIL import Image
import requests


def get_image(path):
    ''' image '''
    image = None
    if path.startswith('http'):
        res = requests.get(path)
        image = Image.open(io.BytesIO(res.content))
    else:
        image = Image.open(path)
    return image

def image2bytes(image):
    ''''''
    img_bytes = io.BytesIO()
    image.save(img_bytes, image.format)
    return img_bytes.getvalue()

def overlay(big_path, small_path, width, height, small_thumbnail=()):
    ''''''
    big_image = get_image(big_path)
    small_image = get_image(small_path)
    if small_thumbnail:
        small_image.thumbnail(small_thumbnail)
    big_image.paste(small_image,(width, height))
    big_image.show()    # 
    #  big_image.save('/Users/wxnacy/Downloads/pillow_overlay.png')  # 
    # 
    return image2bytes(big_image)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    overlay('https://wxnacy.com/images/rss.png',
            'https://wxnacy.com/images/mp.jpg', 157, 45)
```

<!-- more -->

## 

```bash
$ docker logs --help

Usage:  docker logs [OPTIONS] CONTAINER

Fetch the logs of a container

Options:
      --details        Show extra details provided to logs
  -f, --follow         Follow log output
      --since string   Show logs since timestamp (e.g. 2013-01-02T13:23:37) or relative (e.g. 42m for 42 minutes)
      --tail string    Number of lines to show from the end of the logs (default "all")
  -t, --timestamps     Show timestamps
      --until string   Show logs before a timestamp (e.g. 2013-01-02T13:23:37) or relative (e.g. 42m for 42 minutes)
```

 `tail -f` 10 `--tail` 

** 10 **

```bash
$ docker logs -f --tail 10 <container-id>
```



****

```bash
$ docker logs -t --since="2019-08-20T13:23:37" <container-id>
```

** 10 **

```bash
$ docker logs -t --since=10m <container-id>
```

****

```bash
$ docker logs -t --since="2019-08-20T13:23:37" --until="2019-08-21T13:23:37" <container-id>
```

##  grep

 `grep`  `docker logs` 

```bash
$ docker logs -f --tail 10 <container-id> 2>&1 | grep 'grep thing'
```

 `getattr` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)
# Description:

def format_size(size: int):
    ''''''
    unit = {
        0: 'B',
        1: 'K',
        2: 'M',
        3: 'G',
        4: 'T',
    }

    for i in range(6):
        if 1024 ** i <= size < 1024 ** ( i + 1 ):
            if i > 0:
                size = size / 1024 ** i
            return '{:0.1f}{}'.format( size, unit[i])
    return '{}B'.format(size)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    import sys
    module = sys.modules[__name__]
    args = sys.argv[1:]
    func_name = args[0]
    func = getattr(module, func_name)
    res = func(int(args[1]))
    print(res)

    # 
    # $ python utils.py format_size 1024
```

Post.title: Python
Post._content:
Python  `list.sort()` `key` 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

 sql  `order by id, age` 

py2  `sort()`  `cmp` py3 

py3  `functools` 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

from functools import cmp_to_key

def cmp_func(a, b):

    if a['id'] < b['id']:
        return -1
    elif a['id'] > b['id']:
        return 1

    if a['name'] < b['name']:
        return -1
    elif a['name'] > b['name']:
        return 1

    return 0

arr.sort(key=cmp_to_key(cmp_func))
```

 `id`  `id`  `age` 

 demo

Post.title: youtube-dl
Post._content:
nice  [youtube-dl](https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl) 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

## 

### pip

```bash
$ sudo -H pip install --upgrade youtube-dl
```

### Linux

```bash
$ sudo wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/latest/youtube-dl -O /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
$ sudo chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl
```

### Mac

```bash
$ brew install youtube-dl
```

### Windows

 [youtube-dl.exe](https://yt-dl.org/latest/youtube-dl.exe) 

 Windows10  `MSVCR100.dll`  [Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable Package (x86)](https://www.microsoft.com/en-US/download/details.aspx?id=5555) `youtube-dl.exe` 

## 

```bash
$ youtube-dl https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKIfTOEo7P0
```

 720p 

```bash
$ youtube-dl -F https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKIfTOEo7P0
```

![1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wxnacy/image/master/blog/ytdl1.png)

 1080p 

```bash
$ youtube-dl -f 137 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKIfTOEo7P0
```

 webm  mp4 

```bash
$ youtube-dl -f mp4 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKIfTOEo7P0
```

## 

`youtube-dl` +



 `-o` 

****

```bash
$ youtube-dl -o '%(playlist)s/%(playlist_index)s - %(title)s.%(ext)s' https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLumqm-XDIBr1tduTDECpjF_l33IVupKAN
```

 `/ - .`

****

```bash
$ youtube-dl -o '%(uploader)s/%(title)s.%(ext)s' https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCahEYs3JbJQL-oyL_0H9pRA
```

 `/.`

[](https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl#output-template)

 `-i` 

****

```bash
$ youtube-dl -o '%(playlist)s/%(playlist_index)s - %(title)s.%(ext)s' https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLumqm-XDIBr1tduTDECpjF_l33IVupKAN
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
```

```python
from pypinyin import lazy_pinyin
import os

def hans2py(hans):
    ''''''

    return all_words

dirs = os.listdir()
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
```

Post.title: Python urllib3
Post._content:
urllib3  Python HTTP  Python  urllib3 [Requests](https://requests.readthedocs.io/)  [Pip](https://pip.pypa.io/)

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

## 



```python
>>> import urllib3
```

 PoolManager 

```python
>>> http = urllib3.PoolManager()
```



```python
>>> r = http.request('GET', 'http://httpbin.org/robots.txt')
>>> r.data
b'User-agent: *\nDisallow: /deny\n'
```

`r.data` 

## 



```python
>>> r = http.request('GET', 'http://httpbin.org/ip')
>>> r.status
200
```



```python
>>> r.data
b'{\n  "origin": "104.232.115.37"\n}\n'
```



```python
>>> r.headers
HTTPHeaderDict({'Content-Length': '33', ...})
```

 JSON 

```python
>>> import json
>>> json.loads(r.data.decode('utf-8'))
{'origin': '104.232.115.37'}
```



```python
>>> r = http.request('GET', 'http://httpbin.org/bytes/8')
>>> r.data
b'\xaa\xa5H?\x95\xe9\x9b\x11'
```

## 



```python
>>> r = http.request(
...     'GET',
...     'http://httpbin.org/headers',
...     headers={
...         'X-Something': 'value'
...     })
```

****

GET, HEAD, DELETE 

```python
>>> r = http.request(
...     'GET',
...     'http://httpbin.org/get',
...     fields={'arg': 'value'})
>>> json.loads(r.data.decode('utf-8'))['args']
{'arg': 'value'}
```

POST, PUT  urlencode 

```python
>>> from urllib.parse import urlencode
>>> encoded_args = urlencode({'arg': 'value'})
>>> url = 'http://httpbin.org/post?' + encoded_args
>>> r = http.request('POST', url)
>>> json.loads(r.data.decode('utf-8'))['args']
{'arg': 'value'}
```



```python
>>> r = http.request(
...     'POST',
...     'http://httpbin.org/post',
...     fields={'field': 'value'})
>>> json.loads(r.data.decode('utf-8'))['form']
{'field': 'value'}
```

JSON 


```python
>>> import json
>>> data = {'attribute': 'value'}
>>> encoded_data = json.dumps(data).encode('utf-8')
>>> r = http.request(
...     'POST',
...     'http://httpbin.org/post',
...     body=encoded_data,
...     headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'})
>>> json.loads(r.data.decode('utf-8'))['json']
{'attribute': 'value'}
```



 `multipart/form-data`  `(file_name, file_data)`

```python
>>> with open('example.txt') as fp:
...     file_data = fp.read()
>>> r = http.request(
...     'POST',
...     'http://httpbin.org/post',
...     fields={
...         'filefield': ('example.txt', file_data),
...     })
>>> json.loads(r.data.decode('utf-8'))['files']
{'filefield': '...'}
```

 `MIME` 

```python
>>> r = http.request(
...     'POST',
...     'http://httpbin.org/post',
...     fields={
...         'filefield': ('example.txt', file_data, 'text/plain'),
...     })
```

 body  Content-Type 

```python
>>> with open('example.jpg', 'rb') as fp:
...     binary_data = fp.read()
>>> r = http.request(
...     'POST',
...     'http://httpbin.org/post',
...     body=binary_data,
...     headers={'Content-Type': 'image/jpeg'})
```

## 

 float 

```python
>>> http.request(
...     'GET', 'http://httpbin.org/delay/3', timeout=4.0)
<urllib3.response.HTTPResponse>
```

 `Timeout` 

```python
>>> http.request(
...     'GET',
...     'http://httpbin.org/delay/3',
...     timeout=urllib3.Timeout(connect=1.0, read=2.0))
```

`PoolManager` 

```python
>>> http = urllib3.PoolManager(timeout=3.0)
>>> http = urllib3.PoolManager(
...     timeout=urllib3.Timeout(connect=1.0, read=2.0))
```

## 

 urllib3  3  3  `retries` 

 10 

```python
>>> http.requests('GET', 'http://httpbin.org/ip', retries=10)
```

 `retries=False` 

```python
>>> http.request(
...     'GET', 'http://nxdomain.example.com', retries=False)
NewConnectionError
>>> r = http.request(
...     'GET', 'http://httpbin.org/redirect/1', retries=False)
>>> r.status
302
```



```python
>>> r = http.request(
...     'GET', 'http://httpbin.org/redirect/1', redirect=False)
>>> r.status
302
```

 `Retry` 

 3  2 

```python
>>> http.request(
...     'GET',
...     'http://httpbin.org/redirect/3',
...     retries=urllib3.Retry(3, redirect=2))
```

 `PoolManager` 

```python
>>> http = urllib3.PoolManager(retries=False)
>>> http = urllib3.PoolManager(
...     retries=urllib3.Retry(5, redirect=2))
```

[](https://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user-guide.html)


Post.title: Mysql
Post._content:
Mysql 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

Mysql 

## concat()



```mysql
mysql> select concat(id, type) from mm_content limit 10;
+------------------+
| concat(id, type) |
+------------------+
| 100818image      |
| 100824image      |
| 100825video      |
| 100826video      |
| 100827video      |
| 100828video      |
| 100829video      |
| 100830video      |
| 100831video      |
| 100832video      |
+------------------+
10 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```

 NULL NULL

```mysql
mysql> select concat(id, type, tags) from mm_content limit 10;
+------------------------+
| concat(id, type, tags) |
+------------------------+
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
| NULL                   |
+------------------------+
10 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```

## concat_ws()



`concat_ws()`  NUll NUll

```mysql
mysql> select concat_ws(' ', id, type, tags) from mm_content limit 10;
+--------------------------------+
| concat_ws(' ', id, type, tags) |
+--------------------------------+
| 100818 image                   |
| 100824 image                   |
| 100825 video                   |
| 100826 video                   |
| 100827 video                   |
| 100828 video                   |
| 100829 video                   |
| 100830 video                   |
| 100831 video                   |
| 100832 video                   |
+--------------------------------+
10 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```

## group_concat()



```mysql
mysql> select id from test_user group by age;
ERROR 1055 (42000): Expression #1 of SELECT list is not in GROUP BY clause and contains nonaggregated column 'test_user.id' which is not functionally dependent on columns in GROUP BY clause; this is incompatible with sql_mode=only_full_group_by
```

 `group_concat()` 

```mysql
mysql> select group_concat(name) from test_user group by age;
+--------------------+
| group_concat(name) |
+--------------------+
| wen,ning           |
| wxnacy,win         |
+--------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```



```mysql
mysql> select group_concat(name separator ' ') from test_user group by age;
+----------------------------------+
| group_concat(name separator ' ') |
+----------------------------------+
| wen ning                         |
| wxnacy win                       |
+----------------------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```



```mysql
mysql> select group_concat(name order by id desc separator ' ') from test_user group by age;
+---------------------------------------------------+
| group_concat(name order by id desc separator ' ') |
+---------------------------------------------------+
| ning wen                                          |
| win wxnacy                                        |
+---------------------------------------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```

 `concat_ws()` 

```mysql
mysql> select group_concat(concat_ws(',', id, name) separator ' ') from test_user group by age;
+------------------------------------------------------+
| group_concat(concat_ws(',', id, name) separator ' ') |
+------------------------------------------------------+
| 1,wen 2,ning                                         |
| 3,wxnacy 4,win                                       |
+------------------------------------------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
```

Post.title: Python
Post._content:
Python 

<!-- more -->
<!-- toc -->

****

- `strftime("%W")` 
- 
- 



```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

from datetime import datetime

def get_week_of_month(query_date):
    """
    
    """
    end = int(query_date.strftime("%W"))
    begin = int(datetime(query_date.year, query_date.month, 1).strftime("%W"))
    return end - begin + 1
```

Python

****

- `strftime("%W")` 
-

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

from datetime import datetime

def get_week_of_month(query_date):
    """
    
    """
    end = int(query_date.strftime("%W"))
    begin = int(datetime(query_date.year, query_date.month, 1).strftime("%W"))
    return end - begin + 1
```

## ansible
### 
```bash

```
### hosts
/etc/ansible/hosts hosts
```bash
[wxnacy] # 
wxnacy.server.org ansible_ssh_pass=your_pass ansible_ssh_user=your_name

[prod] # sshkey
prod.server.org ansible_ssh_user=your_name ansible_ssh_private_key_file=key_path
```
## 

- ping

```bash
$ ansible all -m ping


wxnacy.server.org | SUCCESS => {
    "changed": false,
    "ping": "pong"
}
prod.server.org | SUCCESS => {
    "changed": false,
    "ping": "pong"
}
```
, `ansible wxnacy -m ping` 


- 

```bash
$ ansible prod -m shell -a "uname -a"

prod.server.org | SUCCESS | rc=0 >>
Linux ip-172-31-5-249 4.9.27-14.31.amzn1.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed May 10 01:58:40 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

## hosts
hostshosts
```bash
ansible my -i hosts_path -m ping
```

Post.title: ansible3 Playbooks
Post._content:
[ansible](/2017/08/14/ansible-2017-08-14-album-study-notes/)

> Playbooks hosts

<!-- more -->

## 

playbook.ymlhosttag_name 
```bash
- hosts: '{{host}}'
  tasks:
  - name: deploy
    shell: ./deploy_api.sh '{{tag_name}}'
    args:
      chdir: ~/path

```

 `--extra-vars`  `-e` ,
- key=value
```bash
ansible-playbook playbook.yml --extra-vars "host=xxx tag_name=xxx"
```
- json
```bash
ansible-playbook playbook.yml --extra-vars "{'host':'xxx','tag_name':'xxx'}"
```
- jaon
```bash
ansible-playbook playbook.yml --extra-vars "kwargs.json"
```

## hosts

/etc/ansible/hosts `--inventory-file`  `-i` playbookhosts
```bash
ansible-playbook playbook.yml --inventory-file=~/ansible-hosts
```

> Regular ExpressionregexregexpRE

<!-- more --><!-- toc -->
## 
<!-- more -->
```bash
^       "  RegExp  Multiline ^  '\n'  '\r' 
$       " RegExp  Multiline $  '\n'  '\r' 
.       "  "\n"  '\n' "(.|\n)"
x|y     "  x  y'z|food'  "z"  "food"'(z|f)ood'  "zood"  "food"
[xyz]   "  '[abc]'  "plain"  'a'
[^xyz]  "  '[^abc]'  "plain" 'p''l''i''n'
[a-z]   " '[a-z]'  'a'  'z' 
[^a-z]  " '[^a-z]'  'a'  'z' 
\b      "  'er\b' "never"  'er' "verb"  'er'
\B      " 'er\B'  "verb"  'er' "never"  'er'
\cx     "  x  \cM  Control-M x  A-Z  a-z  c  'c' 
\d      "  [0-9]
\D      "  [^0-9]
\f      "  \x0c  \cL
\n      "  \x0a  \cJ
\r      "  \x0d  \cM
\s      "  [ \f\n\r\t\v]
\S      "  [^ \f\n\r\t\v]
\t      "  \x09  \cI
\v      "  \x0b  \cK
\w      " '[A-Za-z0-9_]'
\W      "  '[^A-Za-z0-9_]'
```
## 
```bash
*       " zo*  "z"  "zoo"* {0,}
+       " 'zo+'  "zo"  "zoo" "z"+  {1,}
?       " "do(es)?"  "do"  "does" ?  {0,1}
{n}     " n  n 'o{2}'  "Bob"  'o' "food"  o
{n,}    " n n 'o{2,}'  "Bob"  'o' "foooood"  o'o{1,}'  'o+''o{0,}'  'o*'
{n,m}   " m  n n <= m n  m "o{1,3}"  "fooooood"  o'o{0,1}'  'o?'
```

## Python
`re`  Python 

### 
```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

import re

RE_CHINESE = re.compile(u"[\u4e00-\u9fa5]+")  # 
RE_ENGLISH = re.compile(u"[A-Za-z]+")  # 

def find_chinese(str):
    """  """
    return re.findall(RE_CHINESE, str)

def find_english(str):
    """  """
    return re.findall(RE_ENGLISH, str)
```

## ssh-key

```bash
ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "$your_email"          #  sshkey
cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub                       #  sshkey
```

##  git

 git  `id_rsa.pub`  github 



```bash
git config --global user.name wxnacy            # 
git config --global user.email xxx@qq.com       # 
git config --global push.default simple
git push -u origin master
```


## 
```bash
cd project_root                             # 
git init                                    # git
git add .                                   # 
git commit -m 'init commit'                 # 
git remote add origin ${repository_path}    # git server
git pull origin master                      # 
git push origin master                      # push
git clone ${repository_path}                # clone
```

## 
```bash
rm -r file_path
git rm -r ${file_path}
git commit -m 'remove'
git pull origin master
git push origin master
```
## 
```bash
git config --global user.name wxnacy            # 
git config --global user.email xxx@qq.com       # 

$ git config user.name      # 
$ git config user.email     # 
```

## 
 `clone`  `clone` 
```bash
git config credential.helper store
```
## 
### 
 `git commit --amend` 
```bash
git commit -m 'initial commit'
git add forgotten_file
git commit --amend
```
### 
```bash
git checkout -- <file>              # 
git reset HEAD <file>...            # "git add"
git reset HEAD^                     # 
git reset HEAD^ a.py                # a.py
git reset soft HEAD~3              # 3
git reset hard origin/master       # 
git reset 057d                      # 
git revert HEAD                     # commitcommit.(git)
git merge --abort                   # 
```

```bash
git -c core.quotepath=false rm --cached -f -- env.sh
git -c core.quotepath=false checkout HEAD -- env.sh
```
## remote url
```bash
git remote set-url origin ${new_repository_path}
```

## 

```bash
git checkout -b ${new_branch} master    # master
git checkout ${branch_name}             # 
git checkout -b {local-branch-name} origin/{remote-branch-name} # 
git merge --no-off ${branch_name}       # master
git rebase origin master # master
git pull origin {branch-name}           # 
```

## 

```bash
git tag ${tag_name} master              # 
git push origin ${tag_name}             # 
git branch -D ${branch_tag_name}        # 
git push origin :${branch_tag_name}     # 
```

## 



### status
```bash
git status          # 
```

### log

```bash
git log             # 
git log -1          # 1 -nn
git log --stat      # 
git log -p -m       # 
git log v2.0        # v2.0
```

### show
```bash
git show dfb02e6e4f2f7b573         # 
git show dfb02                     # commitid
git show HEAD                      # HEAD
git show HEAD^                     # HEAD ^^ ^55
git show v2.0                      # v2.0
```

### diff
```bash
git diff                                  # index
git diff --cached                         # indexcommit
git diff HEAD^                            # 
git diff HEAD -- ./lib                    # HEADlib
git diff origin/master..master            # mastermaster
git diff origin/master..master --stat     # 
```

- [Pro Git](https://git-scm.com/book/zh/v2)

## HTTP

```bash

```

## 
```bash

```

## 
```bash
# GET
$ curl localhost:8002/test?data=xxx
# POST--data-d
$ curl -X POST localhost:8002/test --data "name=xxx" --data "password=xxx"
$ curl -X POST localhost:8002/test -H "Content-Type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -d "name=win"
# application/json json
$ curl -X POST localhost:8002/test -H "Content-Type:application/json" -d '{"name":"wxnacy"}'
#curl`--data-urlencode`
$ curl -X POST localhost:8002/test --data-urlencode "data=1 2"
```

## 
```bash
$ curl --form upload_field=@localfilename localhost:8002/test
$ curl --form "upload_field=@new.txt;type=text/plain" localhost:8002/test
```

## Referer
requestreferer
```bash
$ curl localhost:8002/test --referer ${from_url}
```
## user-agent
 `--user-agent`  `-A`  user-agent 
```bash
$ curl localhost:8002/test --user-agent "device"
```
## cookie
```bash
# cookieresponse headers
$ curl localhost:8002/test --cookie "name=ss"
# -c cookies
$ curl localhost:8002/test -c ${cookie_file}
# -b cookie
$ curl localhost:8002/test -b ${cookie_file}
```


## HTTP
HTTP cURL `--user` `-u`
```bash
# AuthorizationBasic + name:passbase64
$ curl localhost:8002/test --user name:apss
```

Post.title: Linux CentOS SSHD
Post._content:
>  CentOS sshd

## 

CentOS < 7.x
```bash
service command     # servicestart|stop|restart sshd
chkconfig command   # turn on or off sshd
```

CentOS >= 7.x
```bash
systemctl command #  start|stop|start sshd
```

## CentOS < 7.x

### chkconfig
```bash
$ chkconfig sshd on     # sshd
$ chkconfig sshd off    # sshd
$ chkconfig --list sshd # 
```

### service

```bash
$ service sshd start | stop | restart
or
$ /etc/init.d/sshd start | stop | restart
```

## CentOS >= 7.x

```bash
$ systemctl enable sshd.service     # sshd
$ systemctl disable sshd.service    # sshd
$ systemctl start sshd.service      # sshd
$ systemctl restart sshd.service    # 
$ systemctl stop sshd.service       # 
$ systemctl reload sshd.service     # 
$ systemctl status sshd.service     # 
```

Post.title: Linux  SFTP  SCP
Post._content:
> linux SSH SSH  SFTP  SCP  SSH Port 22 FTP .

<!-- more -->
## SFTP

SFTP  SSH  @
```bash
$ sftp root@localhost
root@localhost's password: # 
sftp> exit # FTP 
```

## sshd 
 sshd  `/etc/ssh/sshd_config`  Linux distribution   ( #)
```bash
$ vim /etc/ssh/sshd_config

# 1.  SSH Server  port 
# Port 22

#  sshd  port number 

Protocol 2
#  SSH  1  2 CentOS 5.x  V2

# ListenAddress 0.0.0.0
#  IP 192.168.1.100 
# 192.168.100.254 192.168.1.100  sshd 
#  ListenAddress 192.168.1.100  SSH 

# PidFile /var/run/sshd.pid
#  SSHD  PID 

# LoginGraceTime 2m
#  SSH server 
#  SSH server 

# Compression delayed
#  yes, no  (delayed)

# 2.  Private Key 
# HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key        # SSH version 1 
# HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key    # SSH version 2  RSA 
# HostKey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key    # SSH version 2  DSA 
#  SSH  Host Key 

# 3.  daemon 
SyslogFacility AUTHPRIV
#  SSH SSH  daemon name
#  AUTH  /var/log/secure 
#  Linux  daemon name DAEMON,USER,AUTH,
# LOCAL0,LOCAL1,LOCAL2,LOCAL3,LOCAL4,LOCAL5,

# LogLevel INFO
# 

# 4. 
# 4.1 
# PermitRootLogin yes
#  root  no

# StrictModes yes
#  sshd 
# 
#  ~.ssh/ 

# PubkeyAuthentication yes
# AuthorizedKeysFile      .ssh/authorized_keys
#  version 2
#  .ssh/authorized_keys 

PasswordAuthentication yes
#  yes 

# PermitEmptyPasswords no
#  yes  no 
# 

# 4.2 
# RhostsAuthentication no
#  .rhosts .rhosts no

# IgnoreRhosts yes
#  ~/.ssh/.rhosts 

# RhostsRSAAuthentication no #
#  version 1  rhosts  /etc/hosts.equiv
#  RSA 

# HostbasedAuthentication no
#  version 2 

# IgnoreUserKnownHosts no
#  ~/.ssh/known_hosts 
#  no 

ChallengeResponseAuthentication no
#  login.conf 
#  PAM  no 

UsePAM yes
#  PAM 
#  UsePAM  ChallengeResponseAuthentication  no

# 4.3  Kerberos  Kerberos 
# KerberosAuthentication no
# KerberosOrLocalPasswd yes
# KerberosTicketCleanup yes
# KerberosTgtPassing no

# 4.4  X-Window 
X11Forwarding yes
# X11DisplayOffset 10
# X11UseLocalhost yes
#  X11Forwarding  ssh 
#  ssh 

# 4.5 
# PrintMotd yes
#  yes
#  /etc/motd  no 

# PrintLastLog yes
#  yes 

# TCPKeepAlive yes
#  TCP 
# 
# SSH
#  no 

UsePrivilegeSeparation yes
#  sshd  port 22 
#  root  student 
#  sshd  sutdent  sshd 

MaxStartups 10
#  SSH 
# 
# 

# 4.6 
DenyUsers *
# 
# 
DenyUsers test

DenyGroups test
#  DenyUsers 

# 5.  SFTP 
Subsystem       sftp    /usr/lib/ssh/sftp-server
# UseDNS yes
#  DNS 
#  no 
```

Post.title: Linux (Redirection)
Post._content:
<!-- toc -->
<!-- more -->
## 
```bash
(stdin)  0  <  <<
(stdout) 1  >  >>
(stderr) 2  2>  2>>
```

## stdout
*1>*  *>* 
```bash
$ ll > ll.txt       #  ll.txt 
# >  >>
```

## stderr
*2>* 
```bash
$ z                             # 

pyenv: z: command not found     # 

The `z' command exists in these Python versions:
  2.7.12/envs/env_hamster
  env_hamster

$ z 2> err.log                  # 
```




```bash
$ z > file.log 2> file.log
```


```bash
$ z > file.log 2>&1
$ z &> file.log
# 
```

### /dev/null 

```bash
$ z 2> /dev/null                # 
```

## stdin
 stdout  stderr 
```bash
$ cat > cat.txt
hello world
test
#  ctrl + d 
```
 **** 
****  **<** 
```bash
$ cat > cat.txt < ~/.bashrc

$ ll cat.txt ~/.bashrc
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff    42B  8 27 08:14 /Users/wxnacy/.bashrc
-rw-r--r--  1 wxnacy  staff    42B  9 11 09:50 cat.txt
```
 **<** 

 **<<**
 `ctrl + d` 

```bash
$ cat > cat.txt << "eof"
hello world
eof                     #  ctrl + d 
```
 **<<**  **** eof

Post.title: expect
Post._content:
> Expect


<!-- more -->

<!-- toc -->
## 

 sshftp mysql 
 **[expect](http://expect.sourceforge.net/)** 
 *mysql_login* 


```bash
#!/usr/bin/env expect
set password xxxxx
set name root

spawn mysql -u$name -p
expect "*assword:*"
send "$password\r"
interact
```
 mysql 
```bash
$ expect mysql_login
```
 *sh file*  *expect mysql_login* 
`#!/usr/bin/env expect`  `./mysql_login` 



- **spawn**spawnexpect
- **expect "*assword:*"** password
 mysql  password  xxxxxxxx password:
- **send**
- **interact**

 ssh 
[SSH ](/2017/08/23/linux-2017-08-23-ssh/)


## 

### 
 bash `./mysql_login p1 p2 p3 p4`
 bash  **$1 $2** 
 expect  **$arg** 
```bash
puts $argv                      ==> p1 p2 p3 p4     # 
puts $argc                      ==> 4               # 
puts [lindex $argv 0]           ==> p1              #  lindex 
puts [lrange $argv 0 2]         ==> p1 p2 p3        #  lrange 
```

### 
 bash  export  echo 
expect  **set**  **puts** 
 **env()** 
```bash
wxnacy@wxnacydeMacBook-Pro ~/W/w/s/mysql> expect
expect1.1> set env(NAME) "wxnacy"       # NAME  bash 
wxnacy
expect1.2> puts $env(NAME)              # 
wxnacy
```

###  if
 expect  **if** 
 expect  **if** `if { name == "wxnacy" }`
```bash
if { $argc < 1 } {
    send_user 'Usage: ./mysql_login arg1'
}
```

## 
- [expect - ](http://xstarcd.github.io/wiki/shell/expect.html)
- [expect](http://blog.51niux.com/?id=55)

##  DNS 
OS X  DNS  DNS  DNS  DNS 
 Mac  DNS  Mac  OS X  DNS  OS X 
## OS X Yosemite
 OS X v10.10.4  DNS 
```bash
sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder
```
 OS X v10.10  v10.10.3  DNS 
```bash
sudodiscoveryutil mdnsflushcache
```
## OS X MavericksMountain Lion  Lion
 OS X v10.9.5  DNS 
```bash
sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder
```
## Mac OS X Snow Leopard
 OS X v10.6  v10.6.8  DNS 
```bash
sudo dscacheutil -flushcache
```

 HomeBrew 

## 
### 

```bash
$ brew install wget
```
 Mac  wget 

```bash
$ cd /usr/local
$ ls -l bin | grep 'wget'
wget -> ../Cellar/wget/1.19.1_1/bin/wget
```
HomeBrew  /usr/local/Cellar  /usr/local/bin 

### 
```bash
$ brew install wget             # 
$ brew search wget              # eqbrew search /^wg/
$ brew info wget                # 
$ brew uninstall wget           # 
$ brew switch wget 1.9.1        # 
$ brew outdated                 # 
$ brew upgrade wget             # 
$ brew update                   #  HomeBrew 
$ brew cleanup wget             # 
$ brew list                     # 
$ echo $(brew --prefix wget)    # /usr/local/opt/wget
```

### oh-my-zsh

## 
###  
```mysql
create database name character utf8mb4;
```
## 
### 
```mysql
drop table if exists `user`;
create table `user`(
    id int(11) not null auto_increment,
    name varchar(32) not null comment '',
    mobile varchar(11) not null default '' comment '',
    ext JSON default null comment '',
    create_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp comment '',
    update_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp on update current_timestamp comment '',
    primary key(`id`)
) engine=InnoDB default charset=utf8mb4 comment '';
```

### 
```mysql
desc table_name
```
### 
```mysql
alter table table_name rename to new_name;
```
### 
```mysql
alter table table_name add column col_name varchar(11) not null ...;
```
### 
```mysql
alter table table_name drop column col_name;
```
### 
```mysql
alter table table_name change old_name new_name int(11)...;
```
### 
```mysql
alter table table_name modify col_name int(11) not null...;
```

```mysql
show columns from table_name;
show full columns from table_name; #
```

Post._content:
> videocommenttriggerinsertvideocommentvideocomment_count

[mysql](/?p=/doc/mysql/mysql_daily.md)
- video
```mysql
drop table if exists `video`;
create table `video`(
    id int(11) not null auto_increment,
    name varchar(32) not null comment '',
    url varchar(512) not null comment '',
    is_del int(1) not null default 0 comment '',
    create_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp comment '',
    update_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp on update current_timestamp comment '',
    primary key(`id`)
)engine=InnoDB default charset=utf8mb4 comment '';
```

- comment_countadd column(^)
```mysql
alter table video add column comment_count int(11) not null default 0 comment '';
```

- comment
```mysql
drop table if exists `comment`;
create table `comment`(
    id int(11) not null auto_increment,
    resource_id int(11) not null comment 'id',
    resource_type varchar(16) not null comment '',
    content varchar(1024) not null comment '',
    is_del int(1) not null default 0 comment '',
    create_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp comment '',
    update_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp on update current_timestamp comment '',
    primary key(`id`)
)engine=InnoDB default charset=utf8mb4 comment '';
```
- trigger
```mysql
drop trigger if exists `insert_comment`;
delimiter $
create trigger `insert_comment` after insert on comment for each row
begin
    if (new.resource_type = 'video') then 
        update video set comment_count = comment_count +1 where id = new.resource_id;
    end if;
end $
delimiter ;
```

- 

```mysql
insert into video (name,url) values ('','http://woyemeiyou/wangzhi.mp4');
insert into comment (resource_id,resource_type,content) values (1,'video','');
select * from video;
```

videocomment_count1

[http://www.thegeekstuff.com/2010/02/mysql_ps1-6-examples-to-make-your-mysql-prompt-like-angelina-jolie/](http://www.thegeekstuff.com/2010/02/mysql_ps1-6-examples-to-make-your-mysql-prompt-like-angelina-jolie/)
## 
```mysql
mysql> prompt \u@\d>
PROMPT set to '\u@\d> '
root@(none)> use test
Reading table information for completion of table and column names
You can turn off this feature to get a quicker startup with -A

Database changed
root@test>
```

## 

```mysql
wxnacy@wxnacydeMacBook-Pro: ~ $ mysql -u root -p --prompt="\u@\d> "    
root@(none)> use test;
root@test>
```
### bash MYSQL_PS1 
```bash
wxnacy@wxnacydeMacBook-Pro: ~ $ export MYSQL_PS1="\u@\d> "                              
wxnacy@wxnacydeMacBook-Pro: ~ $ mysql -u root -p                            
root@(none)>
```
## /etc/my.cnf

```bash
[mysql]
prompt=\\u@\\d>\\ # \


[mysql]
prompt="\u@\d>"
```
### 
```bash
OptionDescription

\cAcounterthatincrementsforeachstatementyouissue
\DThefullcurrentdate
\dThedefaultdatabase
\hTheserverhost
\lThecurrentdelimiter(newin5.0.25)
\mMinutesofthecurrenttime
\nAnewlinecharacter
\OThecurrentmonthinthree-letterformat(Jan,Feb,)
\oThecurrentmonthinnumericformat
\Pam/pm
\pThecurrentTCP/IPportorsocketfile
\RThecurrenttime,in24-hourmilitarytime(023)
\rThecurrenttime,standard12-hourtime(112)
\SSemicolon
\sSecondsofthecurrenttime
\tAtabcharacter
\UYourfulluser_name@host_nameaccountname

\uYourusername
\vTheserverversion
\wThecurrentdayoftheweekinthree-letterformat(Mon,Tue,)
\YThecurrentyear,fourdigits
\yThecurrentyear,twodigits
\_Aspace
\Aspace(aspacefollowsthebackslash)
\'Singlequote
\"Doublequote
\\Aliteral\backslashcharacter
\xx,foranyxnotlistedabove
```


Post.title: 2017-08-11 trigger
Post.raw:
---
title: 2017-08-11 trigger
date: 2017-08-11
tags: [mysql]
---

> user_eventtrigger

## user_event
```mysql
drop table if exists `user_event`;
create table `user_event`(
	id int(11) not null auto_increment,
	user_id int(11) not null comment 'id',
	type varchar(32) not null comment '',
	resource_id int(11) not null default 0 comment 'id',
	resource_type varchar(32) not null default '' comment '',
	val_num int(11) not null default 0 comment 'int',
	val_str varchar(512) not null default '' comment 'str',
	ext JSON default null comment '',
	is_del tinyint(1) not null default 0 comment '',
	create_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp comment '',
	update_ts timestamp not null default current_timestamp on update current_timestamp comment '',
	primary key(`id`)
)engine=InnoDB default charset=utf8mb4 comment '';
```

## 
```mysql
alter table user add column rank int(11) not null default 0 comment '';
alter table user add column score int(11) not null default 0 comment '';
```

## trigger
```mysql
drop trigger if exists `insert_user_event`;
delimiter $
create trigger `insert_user_event` after insert on `user_event` for each row 
begin
	declare total_score int;
	if (new.type = 'get_score') then
		select sum(val_num) into total_score from user_event where user_id = new.user_id and type  = 'get_score';
		update user set score = total_score where id = new.user_id;
	end if;
end $
delimiter ;
```

## 
```mysql
insert into user_event (user_id,type,val_num) values (1,'get_score',200);
insert into user_event (user_id,type,val_num) values (1,'get_score',200);
select * from user where id = 1;
```
userscore400

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

import os
import sys

cur_file = sys.argv[0]              # ==> 
print(cur_file)
# python test.py                    ==> test.py
# python test/test.py               ==> test/test.py
# python /Users/wxnacy/test/test.py ==> /Users/wxnacy/test/test.py
# __file__ 

cmd_dir = os.getcwd()               # ==> 
print(cmd_dir)
# python test.py                    ==> /Users/wxnacy/test
# python test/test.py               ==> /Users/wxnacy

print(os.listdir(cmd_dir))          # ==> 
print(os.path.exists(cmd_dir))      # ==> 
print(os.path.isfile(cmd_dir))      # ==> 
print(os.path.isdir(cmd_dir))       # ==> 

dirname = os.path.dirname(cur_file) # ==> 
print(dirname)
# os.path.dirname('test.py')        ==> 
# os.path.dirname('test/test.py')   ==> test

abspath = os.path.abspath(cur_file) # ==> 
print(abspath)
# os.path.abspath('')               ==> 
# os.path.abspath('test/test.py')   ==> /Users/wxnacy/test/test.py
# os.path.abspath('/Users/wxnacy')  ==> /Users/wxnacy
```

```bash
    libsqlite3-dev libbz2-dev libreadline-dev
```

```bash
export PYENV_ROOT="$HOME/.pyenv"
export PATH="$PYENV_ROOT/bin:$PATH"
export PYENV_VIRTUALENV_DISABLE_PROMPT=1
eval "$(pyenv init -)"
eval "$(pyenv virtualenv-init -)"
```

```bash
$ pyenv update
```

```bash
rm -rf ~/.pyenv
~/.bash_profile
```

## config.py
```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
''''''
__author__ = "wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)"
__copyright__ = "Copyright of wxnacy (2017)."


from flask import Flask
from werkzeug.contrib.fixers import ProxyFix
import os

CONFIG_NAME_MAPPER = {
    'local': 'app.local_config.LocalConfig',
    'product': 'app.local_config.ProductionConfig',
    'dev': 'app.local_config.DevelopmentConfig',
    'test': 'app.local_config.TestingConfig'
}

def create_app(flask_config_name=None):
    """
    
    :return:
    """
    app = Flask(__name__)
    app.wsgi_app = ProxyFix(app.wsgi_app)
    env_flask_config_name = os.getenv('FLASK_CONFIG')
    config_mapper_name = flask_config_name or env_flask_config_name or 'local'
    config_name = CONFIG_NAME_MAPPER[config_mapper_name]
    app.config.from_object(config_name)

    return app


app = create_app()

```

## run.py 
```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
''''''
__author__ = "wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)"
__copyright__ = "Copyright of wxnacy (2017)."


from app.config import app

@app.route('/test')
def mysql():
    return app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI']

app.run()
```


```bash
myproject:
    app:
        config.py
        local_config.py
    run.py
    env.sh
```

```bash
$ source env.sh
$ python run.py
$ curl http://localhost:5000/test
```

```bash
$ source env.sh product
$ python run.py
$ curl http://localhost:5000/test
mysql+pymysql://root:pass@prod.server.org:3306/db_name?charset=utf8mb4
```

Post.title: SQLAlchemy
Post._content:
<!-- toc -->

## and

filter  filter_by 

```python
User.query.filter_by(id=1,name='win').first()
User.query.filter(User.id==1,User.name == 'win').first()
```

## in
```python
sql = User.query.filter(User.id.in_([1,2]))
print(sql)

> select * from user where id in (1,2)
```

## or
```python
from sqlalchemy import or_
sql = User.query.filter(or_(User.name == 'winn',User.mobile == '183'),User.email == '371')
print(sql)

> select * from user where (name = 'winn' or mobile = '183') and email= '371'
```

## 

```python
from sqlalchemy import desc
User.query.order_by(create_ts).all() # 
User.query.order_by(desc(create_ts)).all() # 
```

## 
```python
User.query.filter(User.age >= 12,User.age < 23).all()
```

## like
```python
User.query.filter(User.name.like('%win%')).all()
```

## JSON 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

# select * from user where json_field -> '$.id' = 1;
User.query.filter(User.json_field['id'] == 1).all()

# select * from user where array_field -> '$[0]' = 1;
User.query.filter(User.array_field[0] == 1).all()

User.query.filter(User.array_field[].contains([1])).all()
```

<!-- toc -->

## and

filter  filter_by 

```python
User.query.filter_by(id=1,name='win').first()
User.query.filter(User.id==1,User.name == 'win').first()
```

## in
```python
sql = User.query.filter(User.id.in_([1,2]))
print(sql)

> select * from user where id in (1,2)
```

## or
```python
from sqlalchemy import or_
sql = User.query.filter(or_(User.name == 'winn',User.mobile == '183'),User.email == '371')
print(sql)

> select * from user where (name = 'winn' or mobile = '183') and email= '371'
```

## 

```python
from sqlalchemy import desc
User.query.order_by(create_ts).all() # 
User.query.order_by(desc(create_ts)).all() # 
```

## 
```python
User.query.filter(User.age >= 12,User.age < 23).all()
```

## like
```python
User.query.filter(User.name.like('%win%')).all()
```

## JSON 

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
# Author: wxnacy(wxnacy@gmail.com)

# select * from user where json_field -> '$.id' = 1;
User.query.filter(User.json_field['id'] == 1).all()

# select * from user where array_field -> '$[0]' = 1;
User.query.filter(User.array_field[0] == 1).all()

User.query.filter(User.array_field[].contains([1])).all()
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
```
